text: Our challenges are very consistent with the
challenges other business organizations face,
which is how do we take friction
out of the way we operate?

After we switched over to
Amazon Redshift,

we saw significant improvements
in our SLA deliverables

with about 18% improvement
with our service levels.

Our disaster recovery and
business continuity plan
are much more robust.
With this switch, we've seen close
to 35% reduction in our operating cost.

We want to pass on as much
value to our customers

and taking cost out of
business is one way to do that.
Also, just keeping up

with the innovation solution
that we have is one of a kind.
It's a functionally rich industry-leading
data warehousing solution
where we have a single source of truth
that allows business to understand
how it's performing.
It provides the pulse of the organization.
With all the innovation that's happening
with the Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio,
you have one-stop shop to interact
with various Amazon Web Services.
Redshift and SageMaker Lakehouse.

It makes the developer
experience that much more better.
It also improves speed to market

because you don't have to
jump across multiple services.
The features like Amazon Q Developer
is something very exciting
and we want to explore that further
and see how that will help us
improve our developer productivity
and our speed to market
and build better quality solutions.
